text: The FIBA Saporta Cup Finals was the championship finals series of the now defunct FIBA Saporta Cup competition. FIBA Saporta Cup was the name of the European-wide second-tier level professional club basketball competition. It was the competition in which the domestic National Cup winners from all over Europe played against each other. The competition was organized by FIBA Europe. It was named after the late Raimundo Saporta, a former Real Madrid director. ==Title holders== 97px * 1966–67 Ignis Varese * 1967–68 AEK * 1968–69 Slavia VŠ Praha * 1969–70 Fides Napoli * 1970–71
